title: The Gut-Longevity Axis: How Your Microbiome Shapes Aging
summary: The nervous system modulates aging by secreting signaling molecules to cell-nonautonomously regulate the physiological state of distal tissues such as the gut. Published in bioRxiv (preprint), this preprint study explores implications for gut-longevity axis.

## What This Means For You

The gut-brain-longevity axis is emerging as a central regulator of aging. Your gut microbiome communicates with your brain and influences everything from inflammation to metabolism to mood. Maintaining gut health through fiber, fermented foods, and targeted probiotics (like Akkermansia) may be one of the simplest ways to support healthy aging.
